Mohamed Salah's agent rubbishes Liverpool deal rumours

Reports on Sunday suggested that protracted negotiations between the two clubs over the transfer fee had finally reached a conclusion.

However, Salah’s agent Ramy Abbas took to Twitter on Sunday evening to dismiss talk that the transfer was complete.

“It’s amazing what one fan picture, along with a stab-in-the-dark caption, will lead many to believe... #fakenews,” he said.

Once Liverpool's pursuit of Roma winger Mohamed Salah has been concluded, the focus will turn to other areas. (James Pearce)

A dominant centre-back, a reliable left-back and a dynamic centre midfielder are all high up on Jurgen Klopp’s wish-list. (James Pearce)

Klopp has no plans to buy a shot-stopper during the window and Liverpool goalkeeping coach John Achterberg isn’t surprised. (James Pearce)

Achterberg: "My opinion is that in goalkeeping terms things look pretty good for Liverpool. My job is to try to help them to stay positive."

Achterberg: "Loris [Karius] had to wait & work hard & wait for the next chance to come up. His attitude was very good."

Achterberg on Ward: "He showed good consistency for Huddersfield. We’ll bring him back because we want 3 good goalies to fight each other."
